title: R Markdown Introduction
description: Understanding Basics of R Markdown (RMD) Tutorial
contents:
Contents
What is R
Markdown?
R Markdown
View

What is R Markdown?
It is an authoring framework for data-based projects. R Markdown is
also referred to as “RMD”. It is used to connect the data and generate
reports. RMD is a simple plain text file with three types of
content:
YAML metadata to guide the RMD process
Code Chunks to run
Text to display
R Markdown View


Show code

knitr::include_graphics(path = "G:/TA/image/RMD.png")




RMD can be used in the R Interactive Development Environment (IDE)
for productive notebook interface. RMD files are stored as “.RMD” . To
build a report from the RMD file, “knit” function can be used to render
a report. RMD renders the report in familiar formats running the code
and embedding the results in the finished document. RMD builds many
familiar formats, such as:
HTML
PDF
Word Doc
Slide Show
Dashboards & many more…
In every case RMD remains as a reproducible record of work easy to
track in version control system like Git and easy to deploy in
future.
